abstract: Security guards arrest French journalist Florence Hartmann outside United Nations war crimes tribunal for former Yugoslavia in The Hague in order to serve seven-day sentence for 2009 contempt of court conviction; had been convicted for reporting that tribunal judges had negotiated to keep sensitive records provided by Serbia confidential.

headline.print_headline: French Journalist Is Detained at U.N. War Crimes Tribunal
headline.main: French Journalist Is Detained at U.N. War Crimes Tribunal

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Florence Hartmann, a former correspondent for Le Monde, has been locked up at the tribunal prison to serve a pending seven-day sentence for contempt of court.
lead_paragraph: Florence Hartmann, a former correspondent for Le Monde, has been locked up at the tribunal prison to serve a pending seven-day sentence for contempt of court.
